p: Third, finger pointing and the nationalistic blame game are not helpful and distract from identifying real solutions. New models of international and multilateral cooperation are needed to strengthen the political dialogues and responses to climate shocks.13 Distributed and diversified supply chains add to resilience, but having supportive multilevel governance in place is necessary to ensure positive outcomes for all countries. Retreating into nationalistic cages could increase ignorance by focusing too heavily on local needs, losing sight of a global perspective, and negatively affecting supply-chain resiliency and sustainability.
